availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Amos M. Feeback (Nicholas County, Kentucky, cabinet maker, wagon maker, and postmaster.)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, cabinet maker, wagon maker, and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Anna "Anny" Dewitt Feeback in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on March 31, 1840. Father of John D. Feeback, Mary M. Feeback, Jacob A. Feeback, Milton A. Feeback, James W. Feeback, Martha J. Feeback, and Margaret Elizabeth Feeback Crump. Cabinet maker in Nicholas County in 1850. Wagon maker in Nicholas County in 1860. Postmaster for Head Quarters in Nicholas County from January 31, 1865 to February 24, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 403B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 419.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #23363.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County County Marriages, Film 000252392, p. 58.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Nicholas County, Kentucky, vol. 28, p. 153.
